text: You can often find Fimir in filthy bogs, shoals and rivers taking their fill of fish and anything else that moves.
With the high ground fortified blood will feed the dirt and drench the Fimir's clubs
They kidnap who they can, turning them into slaves and selling the surplus. Some unlucky human females are kept to continue the Fimir line...
Well-travelled waterways are easy targets and the Fimir take their plunder in a flurry of blood and screams before they disappear back into the mists.
Shearl are excellent scouts and trackers, perfect for kidnapping the unsuspecting.
Fimir strongholds take the form of forbidding, craggy piles of rock, crudely built in the semblance of the fortifications of more civilised races.
After raids, the Fimm share out the slaves in some archaic manner.
Fimm, Shearl and any under Fimir rule must pay a tithe to the Dirach usually in the form of slaves.
Fierce norscan tribesmen pour out in droves harkening their Dark Masters call.
Fimir are no strangers to tearing the fabric of the mortal realm in order to summon demons to their cause.
Only the brave, foolish or a demon themselves would create a portal of this magnitude to the depths of the Chaos Wastes.
To see the end times one must merely gaze through the abyss.
Not much more than a big hole to put the filthy slaves to work in.
The deeper the hole, the greater the reward, but also the risk. And when it's a slave's life on the line we can live with that, even if they can't...

It's not unusual to stumble upon a half-eaten, shriveled corpse of a slave. They complain we delved too greedily and too deep. That we awoke in the darkness ... shadow and flame. Good! Let its foulness join our ranks.
It is not unusual to find daemons among the Fimir war and raiding parties, which are summoned and bound by the Dirachs.
There are countless tales of massive daemonic hounds stalking the moors in search for prey.
The marshes are home to the Fimir's closest allies, where they lurk in ambush.
What horros may lie beneath the surface?
Daemonic servant creatures can be summoned from the deeps to crush the enemy.
Through gruesome rituals and sacrifices, the mightiest daemons are summoned to aid the war effort of the Fimir.
Though the lowest caste of the Fimir, Shearls, cannot wield maces they can still carry clubs and crave for battle like their larger kin.
Every clan has a small cabal of Balefiend Apprentices that are eagerly learning the dark arts from the more experienced Dirachs.
Some say the mighty Fenhulk is the result of fusing troll flesh with the detritus of the swamp, not that you would ask the Dirach unless you wanted to become part of their vile creation.
Here the Dirachs are practicing the art of creating the magical constructs, Fenbeasts, to serve their every whim.
The Marshes of Maddness stretch over huge swathes of the Badlands. Here the Fimir set their traps, capturing slaves and looting those fortunate enough to die.
The fimir are a warrior people and only the strong survive, with mace and club they train relentlessly from the lowly Shearl to the mighty Fimm.
The Fimm are the fighting elite of the Fimir and one on one they will destroy those that dare face them.
Dedicated to the foul Daemoin Princess Kroll, All-Mother of the Marshes and Bogs, the sacrifices and worship offered at this temples empower her physical manifestation in this world.
